Monster.Name: Goblin Shaman
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Adept Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +2) 1st-burning hands (DC 12), sleep (DC 12) 0-touch of fatigue (3, DC 11)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 6, Dex 16, Con 11, Int 10, Wis 13, Cha 7
Monster.Feats: Toughness
Monster.Skills: Fly +5, Heal +5, Ride +7, Stealth +12
Monster.DuringCombat: The goblin shaman stays in the back and tries to hit the PCs with sleep, then relies on her light crossbow. Should the PCs get close to her, she casts burning hands on the next round, trying to get as many PCs possible (unconcerned about hitting other goblins). She then tries to hit one PC each round thereafter with touch of fatigue.
Monster.Morale: The goblin shaman fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: light crossbow with 10 bolts, dagger, wooden holy symbol of Zarongel

Monster.Name: Goblin Warrior
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 11, Dex 15, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 6
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative
Monster.Skills: Fly +1, Ride +7, Stealth +9, Swim +1
Monster.DuringCombat: The goblin warriors are not brilliant tacticians– they attack whoever is closest and keep attacking until their target is dead or they are. One warrior remains at the back, firing his bow, and doesn't resort to melee until the PCs reach him.
Monster.Morale: The goblin warriors fight to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: chain shirt, light wooden shield, shortbow with 20 arrows, short sword

Monster.SQ: trapfinding +1
Monster.BeforeCombat: Two goons wait in area 2 and another two in area 4. When they are sure the PCs are all inside area 1, they leap out and attack the PCs from two directions. One of the goons stays in the doorway to area 4 and hurls stingchucks at the PCs.
Monster.DuringCombat: The goons work together to flank single PCs and bring them down one at a time. If a good is brought to 1 hit point, she drinks her potion and tries to get back into the action.
Monster.Morale: The goons fight until two of them are down–then the other two attempt to flee.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: chain shirt, cestus, daggers (3), stingchucks (3, only one of the goons has these)

Monster.SpecialAttacks: rage, smite good (1/day, +3 damage, persists until target is dead)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 19, Dex 15, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Skill Focus (Perception), Toughness
Monster.Skills: Climb +12, Perception +10
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Rage (Ex) A wolverine that takes damage in combat flies into a rage on its next turn, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +4 to Strength, +4 to Constitution, and –2 to AC. The creature cannot end its rage voluntarily.

Monster.Name: Muminah
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 1st; concentration +3) 5/day-resistant touch
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Cleric Spells Prepared (CL 1st; concentration +3) 1st-bless (already cast), cause fear (DC 13), sanctuaryD 0 (at will)-detect magic, detect poison, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 15, Wis 15, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Selective Channeling, Skill Focus (perception)
Monster.Skills: Heal +6, Knowledge (arcana) +6, Knowledge (history) +6, Knowledge (planes) +6, Knowledge (religion) +6, Perception +7
Monster.SQ: aura, elven magic
Monster.BeforeCombat: Muminah casts bless on the party.
Monster.DuringCombat: Muminah stays in the back and uses channel positive energy to heal her crew. She uses her Selective Channeling feat to keep the two most hurt PCs out of the blast of positive energy. Should a PC get close to her, she uses her next action to cast cause fear on that PC, and if that fails, she casts sanctuary.
Monster.Morale: A brave adventurer and Pathfinder, Muminah fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potions of cure light wounds (2), scroll of doom, scroll of obscuring mist
Monster.OtherGear: chain shirt, elixir of love, quarterstaff, silver holy symbol of Nethys, key to the Temple

Monster.Name: Bega Ethaldreda
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 17, Dex 10, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 13, Cha 8

Monster.SQ: Orc blood

Monster.DuringCombat: Bega attacks whoever she thinks is the strongest melee fighter among the PCs. With her high AC, she hopes to distract the PCs long enough for Micky and Todor to start pelting the PCs with ranged damage.

Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds

Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Perception +4, Stealth +0

His stinger was cut off (thus removing his sting attack and poison), he took a lot of Strength damage from goblin poisons (of which 4 points have yet to heal), and he still has 17 points of damage that haven't healed from the day he was brought here.
Monster.DuringCombat: The scorpion is mindless and injured–he attacks the first PC he sees.
Monster.Morale: The scorpion fights to the death.

Monster.SQ: rogue talents (combat trick, finesse rogue, weapon training), trapfinding +3
Monster.DuringCombat: Guarin flanks with Kanna and they take down one target a time, starting with the closest PC.
Monster.Morale: Guarin fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: +1 chain shirt, +1 rapier, +1 dagger, Varisia treasure map

Monster.Name: Kanna Rhamla Tier 6-7
Monster.SpecialAttacks: claws (2, 1d6+5, treated as magic weapons, 5 rounds/day)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Sorcerer Spells Known (CL 7th; concentration +9; 15% arcane spell failure) 3rd (4/day)-fly, hold person (DC 15), vampiric touch 2nd (7/day)-ghoul touch (DC 14), glitterdust (DC 14), hideous laughter (DC 14), resist energy 1st (7/day)-chill touch (DC 13), color spray (DC 13), mage armor, shocking grasp, true strike 0 (at will)-acid splash, daze (DC 12), detect magic, light, mage hand, open/close, ray of frost (+1 damage per die rolled)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 20, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 8, Wis 10, Cha 15
Monster.Feats: Cleave, Combat Reflexes, Eschew Materials, Improved Initiative, Power Attack, Toughness, Weapon Focus (claws)
Monster.Skills: Bluff +9, Intimidate +9, Knowledge (arcana) +3, Linguistics +0, Perception +7
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Kanna knows the PCs are coming, she drinks a potion of bull's strength and casts shield on herself from a scroll (these spells are figured into her stats). Bull's strength is active for 10 rounds and shield is active for 9 rounds.
Monster.DuringCombat: Kanna is a unique sorcerer–she prefers melee combat. She starts combat trying to catch as many PCs as possible with glitterdust and then flanks with Guarin and alternates between ghoul touch, vampiric touch, shocking grasp, and claw attacks on the PCs. If she starts to feel overwhelmed, she starts hitting PCs with hold person and hideous laughter.
Monster.Morale: Kanna fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, potion of cure moderate wounds, scroll of obscuring mist
Monster.OtherGear: +1 studded leather
Monster.BaseStatistics: AC 17, touch 12, flat-footed 15 (+4 armor, +2 Dex, +1 natural); remove immunity; Melee 2 claws +8 (1d6+4); Special Attacks claws (2, 1d6+4, treated as magic weapons, 5 rounds/ day); Str 16; CMB +6; CMD 18

Monster.Name: Almaut Death Cultist
Monster.Ranged: mwk light crossbow +7 (1d8+1/19-20 plus poison), mwk dagger +6 (1d4+3/19-20)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 6th; concentration +9) 6/day-blast rune (1d6+3 energy damage, 6 rounds), bleeding touch (3 rounds)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Spells Prepared (CL 6th; concentration +9) 3rd-bestow curse* (DC 16), glyph of wardingD* (DC 16), meld into stone 2nd-death knellD* (DC 15), eagle's splendor*, hold person (DC 15), spiritual weapon* 1st-cause fearD (DC 14), cure light wounds (2), deathwatch*, shield of faith* 0-bleed (DC 13), detect poison, read magic, stabilize
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 12, Con 13, Int 10, Wis 16, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Channel Smite, Combat Casting, Extra Channel, Improved Channel, Scribe Scroll, Stealthy, Toughness, Weapon Focus (scimitar)
Monster.Skills: Heal +7, Intimidate +10, Knowledge (religion) +7, Linguistics +4, Perception +4, Sense Motive +7, Spellcraft +4, Stealth +6, Survival +7
Monster.SQ: aura, bravery +1
Monster.BeforeCombat: Prior to infiltrating the Pathfinder Lodge, each cultist uses a scroll of magic vestment to protect himself and a scroll of status to remain aware of one another's condition. They also use death knell against the servants and guards they slay. Once alerted by the activation of the glyph of warding at the gate (or after observing anyone bypassing it), they cast deathwatch, eagle's splendor, and shield of faith on themselves and place blast runes in the squares around them, preparing for an attack.
Monster.DuringCombat: With the power of deathwatch to aid them, the cultists fire poisoned bolts at any PC that avoided damage from the sound burst. Then, they continue sniping at intruders to draw them to the blast runes in front of them. Thereafter, they draw their scimitars and channel negative energy to wear down opponents, trusting in their status effect to warn their colleagues inside the lodge.
Monster.Morale: The cultists retreat to area 3 after falling below 20 hit points so they can cast meld into stone and buy time to heal themselves before renewing the attack.
Monster.Gear: giant wasp poison (2 doses), potion of cure moderate wounds
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork breastplate, masterwork dagger, masterwork light crossbow, 10 +1 bolts, masterwork scimitar, silver holy symbol
Monster.BaseStatistics: AC 17, touch 11, flat-footed 16; hp 52 (5d8+2d10+19); Melee masterwork scimitar +9 (1d6+2/18–20), mwk dagger +8 (1d4+2/19–20); Ranged mwk dagger +6 (1d4+2/19–20); Special Attacks channel negative energy (3d6, DC 14, 5/day); Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 5th; concentration +8) 6/day.blast rune (1d6+2 energy damage, 5 rounds), bleeding touch (2 rounds); Spells Prepared (CL 5th; concentration +8); Str 14, Cha 10; CMB +7; CMD 20; Skills Intimidate +8

Monster.Name: Zuberi-Possessed Ettin
Monster.AC_Mods: (+2 armor, +8 natural, -1 size)(+3 dodge vs. traps)
Monster.DefensiveAbilities: evasion, trap sense +3, improved uncanny dodge
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Rogue Spell-Like Abilities (CL 10th; concentration +13) 3/day-read magic 2/day-magic missile
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 23, Dex 10, Con 15, Int 17, Wis 11, Cha 16
Monster.Feats: Leadership, Magical Aptitude, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Vital Strike, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +4 (+8 jump), Appraise +16, Bluff +16, Diplomacy +16, Intimidate +16, Knowledge (arcana) +8, Knowledge (geography) +6, Knowledge (history) +12, Knowledge (local) +10, Knowledge (nature) +6, Knowledge (nobility) +6, Knowledge (planes) +6, Knowledge (religion) +6, Linguistics +10, Perception +12, Sense Motive +13, Sleight of Hand +9, Spellcraft +10, Stealth +5, Use Magic Device +20
Monster.Languages: Common, Draconic, Giant, Kelish, Osiriani, Sphinx, Terran, Vudrani
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (bleeding attack* +4, combat trick, major magic, minor magic, opportunist), trapfinding, trap sense +3
Monster.BeforeCombat: Zuberi gives the ettin a potion of false life to drink before standing guard outside the ritual chamber.
Monster.DuringCombat: Under the influence of Zuberi's possessing spirit, the ettin holds back while the living monoliths engage PCs first, casting magic missile or throwing javelins instead. Zuberi then readies the ettin's flails and directs him into flanking situations where he can use his sneak attacks to maximum effect.
Monster.Morale: Zuberi forces the ettin to fight to the death.
Monster.Gear: potion of false life (already drank)
Monster.OtherGear: leather armor, masterwork flails (2), javelins (4) Special Abilitie s Superior Two-Weapon Fighting (Ex) Due to his partial possession of only one of the ettin's heads, Zuberi still gains access to its superior two-weapon fighting style. As such, the ettin can still fight with a flail or javelin in each hand and, because each head controls one arm, the ettin does not take a penalty on attack or damage rolls for attacking with two weapons. Zuberi can also apply his combat feats and sneak attack abilities to the attacks controlled by his head.
Monster.BaseStatistics: CE Large humanoid (giant); Init +3; AC 18, touch 8, flat-footed 18; hp 65; Fort +9, Ref +2, Will +5; Defensive Abilities none; Ranged 2 javelins +5 (1d8+6); Special Attacks superior two-weapon fighting; Spell-Like Abilities none; Dex 8, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 11; CMD 23; Feats Cleave, Improved Initiative, Improved Overrun, Iron Will, Power Attack; Skills Handle Animal +8, Perception +12; Racial Modifiers +4 on Perception; Languages pidgin of Giant, Goblin, and Orc

Monster.Name: Enlarged Living Monolith Guard
Monster.Saves: Fort +7, Ref +2, Will +4; +2 vs. death effects, mind-affecting effects, and saves against negative levels, +1 vs. fear
Monster.Save_Mods: +2 vs. death effects, mind-affecting effects, and saves against negative levels, +1 vs. fear
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 6th; concentration +5) 3/day-enlarge person
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 19, Dex 12, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Cleave, Endurance, Iron Will, Power Attack, Toughness, Weapon Focus (falchion), Weapon Specialization (falchion)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +5, Climb +6, Intimidate +5, Knowledge (engineering) +5, Knowledge (history) +5, Knowledge (religion) +5, Linguistics +4, Perception +6, Sense Motive +5, Survival +5
Monster.SQ: armor training +1, bravery +1, ka stone, weapon training (heavy blades) +1
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Ka Stone (Su) During his induction, a living monolith receives an engraved scarab stone in his forehead. This stone is inscribed on its inner side with the monolith's true name and oaths to the gods and pharaohs. It cannot be removed without his permission, cannot be dispelled (though it ceases functioning in areas where magic does not work), and does not use a magic item slot. The ka stone tightly binds the monolith's mind and spirit to his body, providing him with a +2 bonus on saves against negative levels, negative energy, death effects, and mind-affecting effects. A living monolith can also invoke the power of his ka stone three times per day as a swift action, enabling him to grow in size as if using enlarge person (even if he is not a humanoid).
Monster.BeforeCombat: Each living monolith drinks a potion of darkvision and a potion of false life to prepare itself while standing guard during Zuberi's ritual.
Monster.DuringCombat: At the first sign of trouble, the living monoliths invoke their enlarge person ability to grow to Large size, then wade into melee, wielding their falchions two-handed for maximum cleaving power.
Monster.Morale: The living monoliths fight to the death, trusting in Zuberi to raise them once more if they prove themselves worthy.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure moderate wounds, potion of darkvision (already drank), potion of false life (already drank)
Monster.OtherGear: +1 breastplate, javelins (3), masterwork falchion
Monster.BaseStatistics: Medium humanoid (human); Init +2; Senses Perception +6; AC 19, touch 12, flat-footed 17; Melee mwk falchion +11 (2d4+7/18–20); Ranged javelin +7 (1d6+3); Str 17, Dex 14

Monster.AC_Mods: (+2 armor, +2 deflection, -5 Dex, +1 natural)(+3 dodge vs. traps)
Monster.Saves: Fort -2, Ref +0, Will +3; +3 Ref vs. traps
Monster.DefensiveAbilities: evasion, trap sense +3, improved uncanny dodge
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Rogue Spell-Like Abilities (CL 10th; concentration +13) 3/day-read magic 2/day-magic missile
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 1, Dex 1, Con 1, Int 17, Wis 11, Cha 16
Monster.Feats: Leadership, Magical Aptitude, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Toughness, Vital Strike, Weapon Finesse
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +5, Appraise +16, Bluff +16, Diplomacy +16, Intimidate +16, Knowledge (arcana) +8, Knowledge (geography) +6, Knowledge (history) +12, Knowledge (local) +10, Knowledge (nature) +6, Knowledge (nobility) +6, Knowledge (planes) +6, Knowledge (religion) +6, Linguistics +10, Perception +8, Sense Motive +13, Sleight of Hand +10, Spellcraft +10, Stealth +10, Use Magic Device +20
Monster.Languages: Common, Draconic, Giant, Kelish, Osiriani, Sphinx, Terran, Vudrani
Monster.SQ: rogue talents (bleeding attack* +4, combat trick, dispelling attack* [CL 10th], major magic, minor magic), trapfinding, trap sense +3
Monster.BeforeCombat: To prepare for the ritual, Zuberi spirit inhabits the ettin in area 6, freeing him from this crippled body.
Monster.DuringCombat: Zuberi's physical body is too weak to move or take any action, other than mental ones, such as controlling the ettin with his detached spirit.
Monster.Morale: Unwilling to give up his bid for youth and vitality, Zuberi fights to the death in the body of the ettin. If forced to return to this body, it promptly begins to die, as noted in Development.
Monster.Gear: potion of bear's endurance (already drank), potion of displacement, potion of false life (already drank), wand of acid arrow (21 charges), wand of enervation (9 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: amulet of natural armor +1, bracers of armor +2, +1 flaming shortsword, +1 light crossbow, 10 +1 bolts, 2 screaming bolts, ring of protection +2.
Monster.BaseStatistics: Without his bear's endurance and false life, Zuberi's stats are hp 45; Con 6.

Monster.Name: Rysus Soth
Monster.AC_Mods: (+6 armor, +1 deflection, +5 Dex, +1 dodge, +1 natural)(+1 dodge vs. traps)
Monster.Saves: Fort +7, Ref +14, Will +4; +1 Reflex vs traps; +3 Fortitude vs poison
Monster.Save_Mods: +1 lex vs traps+3 itude vs poison
Monster.DefensiveAbilities: improved evasion, improved uncanny dodge, trap sense +1
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 20, Con 16, Int 13, Wis 10, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Combat Expertise, Dodge, Improved Feint, Improved Initiative, Point Blank Shot, Quick Draw, Toughness, Weapon Finesse, Weapon Focus (dagger)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +19, Bluff +14, Climb +11, Diplomacy +14, Disguise +24, Perception +15, Sleight of Hand +20, Stealth +19
Monster.SQ: hidden weapons, poison use, quiet death, rogue talents (combat trick, finesse rogue), trapfinding, true death
Monster.BeforeCombat: Soth uses any interaction with the PCs before beginning combat to determine which Pathfinder seems to be most suspicious or in charge. He prefers to study humans, as he knows himself to be most effective in killing them, but prepares his death attack against whoever seems to be the greatest threat against his ruse.
Monster.DuringCombat: If Soth has prepared his death attack and can execute it against a flat-footed foe, he does so, risking retaliation before he can cast greater teleport the following round.
Monster.Morale: If unable to execute his death attack in the first round, Soth uses his ring of the binding word's daily greater teleport ability to flee to his master's chamber in area C6 in the first round of combat.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure serious wounds (2)
Monster.OtherGear: +2 chain shirt, +1 human bane dagger, masterwork short sword, masterwork shortbow with 20 arrows, amulet of natural armor +1, belt of incredible dexterity +2, cloak of resistance +1, hat of disguise, ring of protection +1, ring of the binding word

Monster.Name: Angazhan Cultist
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 16, Dex 18, Con 12, Int 13, Wis 8, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Acrobatic, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Greater Weapon Focus (shortspear), Mobility, Spring Attack, Weapon Focus (shortspear), Weapon Specialization (shortspear)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +14, Climb +14, Intimidate +10, Perception +7, Survival +10
Monster.SQ: armor training +2, bravery +2, weapon training (spears +1)
Monster.BeforeCombat: If the lookouts spot the approaching Pathfinders and report their arrival to the larger cult, six of them gather their weapons and move to the mouth of the cave, while another six climb vines and ready swinging attacks. If unaware of the PCs, the cultists are dispersed throughout the room, either sleeping or eating.
Monster.DuringCombat: The cultists begin shrieking when they make their first attack and continue until killed. The cultists on the vines swing across the cavern on each turn, using their Combat Expertise, Mobility, and Spring Attack feats to attack PCs as they pass.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to 15 or fewer hit points, a cultist attempts to flee into the jungle.
Monster.Gear: masterwork leather armor, masterwork shortspear

Monster.Name: Chorkak
Monster.Senses: darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent; Perception +20
Monster.Melee: +1 unholy spear +21/+16/+11 (3d6+10/19-20/x3) and touch +13 (1d8+9 plus paralyzing touch) or slam +18 (1d8+9) and touch +18 (1d8+9 plus paralyzing touch)
Monster.SpecialAttacks: channel negative energy (6d6, DC 23, 6/day), paralyzing touch (DC 19), scythe of evil (6 rounds, 2/day)
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Domain Spell-Like Abilities (CL 12th; concentration +17) At Will-speak with animals (15 rounds/day) 8/day-touch of evil (6 rounds)
Monster.SpellsPrepared: Cleric Spells Prepared (CL 12th; concentration +17, ranged touch +12) 6th-antilife shellD (already cast), blade barrier (already cast), harm (DC 21) 5th-dispel goodD (DC 20), righteous might (already cast), spell resistance, slay living (DC 20), true seeing 4th-chaos hammer (DC 19), divine power, summon monster IV, summon nature's ally IVD, unholy blight (DC 19) 3rd-animate dead, bestow curse (DC 18), dispel magic, dominate animalD (DC 18), glyph of warding, invisibility purge 2nd-align weaponD, cure moderate wounds, desecrate (already cast), owl's wisdom, resist energy, silence 1st-bane (DC 16), bless, curse water, doom (DC 16), protection from goodD, protection from law, shield of faith (already cast) 0 (at will)-bleed (DC 15), detect magic, guidance, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 25, Dex 13, Con -, Int 8, Wis 20, Cha 16
Monster.Feats: Boon Companion, Combat Casting, Craft Wondrous Item, Great Fortitude, Greater Weapon Focus (spear), Improved Critical (spear), Toughness, Weapon Focus (spear)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +1, Climb +16, Handle Animal +5, Knowledge (religion) +5, Linguistics +3, Perception +22, Sense Motive +14, Spellcraft +6, Stealth +7
Monster.SQ: aura, animal companion (effective druid level 12), fear aura
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Fear Aura (Su) Creatures with fewer than 5 HD in a 60-foot radius of the lich that look at him must succeed on a Will save or become frightened. Creatures with 5 HD or more must succeed at a Will save or be shaken for a number of rounds equal to the lich's Hit Dice. A creature that successfully saves cannot be affected again by the same lich's aura for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. Paralyzing Touch (Su) Any living creature a lich hits with its touch attack must succeed on a Fortitude save or be permanently paralyzed. Remove paralysis or any spell that can remove a curse can free the victim (see the bestow curse spell description, with a DC equal to the lich's save DC). The effect cannot be dispelled. Anyone paralyzed by a lich seems dead, though a DC 20 Perception check or a DC 15 Heal check reveals that the victim is still alive.
Monster.BeforeCombat: If alerted to the PCs' attack on his cultists in area Z1 or the creatures in Z2, Chorkak casts blade barrier on the entrance to his chamber to provide himself additional time to buff. He augments himself and Garugu with as many of the following as possible, in the following order: antilife shell, righteous might, shield of faith, divine power, and true seeing. He then summons a fiendish dire ape with summon monster IV and three additional apes with summon nature's ally IV on the far side of the wall of blades, using speak with animals to direct them to drop from the ceiling onto foes below, and readies to cast harm on the first PC to bypass the blade barrier.
Monster.DuringCombat: Chorkak prefers to use magic against his enemies, casting such spells as bestow curse, chaos hammer, harm, slay living, and unholy blight, but does not hesitate to engage in melee should PCs penetrate or dispel his antilife sphere. He uses his +1 unholy spear if granted a full attack or his paralyzing touch if restricted to a single attack action. He heals himself with negative energy as needed.
Monster.Morale: Chorkak knows his phylactery is safe and does not fear destruction. He fights to the death.
Monster.Gear: +2 scale mail, +1 unholy spear, belt of giant strength +4, headband of mental prowess + 2 (Cha/Wis)
Monster.BaseStatistics: Str 21, Dex 15, size Large

Monster.Name: Garugu, Gorilla Animal Companion
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 27, Dex 19, Con 14, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved Natural Attack (claw), MultiattackB, Power Attack, Toughness, Weapon Focus (claw)
Monster.Skills: Climb +21, Perception +8, Stealth +7
Monster.SQ: link, share spells, tricks (all but track)
Monster.BeforeCombat: If Chorkak is aware of the PCs' attack, he sends Garugu to the ceiling, instructing her to hide above the entrance to drop on the PCs from above.
Monster.DuringCombat: Garugu drops on the PCs from above on the first round of combat as a charge action, power attacking with a bestial frenzy until all of those attacking Chorkak are dead. If possible, she bull rushes enemies into the blade barrier.
Monster.Morale: Garugu fights to the death to protect her master and mate, Chorkak. If he is slain, however, Garugu reverts to normal ape behavior, no longer under the lich's influence.

Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Toughness
Monster.Skills: Climb +6, Intimidate +3, Ride +5
Monster.DuringCombat: These mercenaries do their best to team up on targets, attempting to overpower them with brute force.
Monster.Morale: If reduced to fewer than 2 hit points, the mercenaries throw down their arms and surrender.
Monster.Gear: chain shirt, short sword

Monster.SQ: trapfinding
Monster.DuringCombat: Janks stands in the square marked X and attacks the PCs at range with his crossbow, preferring to target anyone wearing light or no armor first. He hopes to draw the PCs into the swinging axe trap by making himself a target. Once the axe trap has been activated, Janks backs toward the staircase in the west wall, firing and moving each turn. Janks prefers not to enter melee, but will as a last resort.
Monster.Morale: Janks fights until he has 5 or fewer hit points and then tries to flee up the staircase to area A5.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds

Monster.Name: Burning Skeleton
Monster.Melee: broken scimitar +0 (1d6 plus 1d6 fire) and claw -3 (1d4+1 plus 1d6 fire) or 2 claws +2 (1d4+2 plus 1d6 fire)
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 14, Con -, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 12
Monster.Feats: Improved Initiative
Monster.SQ: fiery aura, fiery death
Monster.SpecialAbilities: Fiery Aura (Ex) Creatures adjacent to a burning skeleton take 1d6 points of fire damage at the start of their turn. Anyone striking a burning skeleton with an unarmed strike or natural attack takes 1d6 points of fire damage. Fiery Death (Su) A burning skeleton explodes into a burst of flame when it dies. Anyone adjacent to the skeleton when it is destroyed takes 1d6 points of fire damage. A DC 12 Reflex save halves this damage.
Monster.DuringCombat: As mindless undead, these skeletons move to attack the nearest opponent and continue targeting that intruder until it is destroyed.
Monster.Morale: The skeletons fight until destroyed.
Monster.Gear: broken chain shirt, broken scimitar

Monster.Name: Celeena Deckland
Monster.Ranged: mwk shortspear +4 (1d6-1) or ranged touch +3 (by spell)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Sorcerer Spells Known (CL 4th; concentration +8) 2nd (4/day)-summon monster II 1st (7/day)-burning hands (DC 15), color spray (DC 15), protection from good, ray of enfeeblement (DC 15) 0 (at will)-acid splash, detect magic, detect poison, mage hand, prestidigitation, read magic
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 8, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 10, Wis 12, Cha 18
Monster.Feats: Augment Summoning, Eschew Materials, Spell Focus (conjuration), Toughness
Monster.Skills: Appraise +6, Diplomacy +10, Knowledge (arcana) +6, Linguistics +1, Spellcraft +5
Monster.SQ: bloodline arcana, infernal resistances
Monster.BeforeCombat: When the PCs attack or talk to the mercenaries in area A5, Celeena is alerted to their presence. At this point she uses her scroll of mage armor and hides behind the northwest shelf. Once she thinks the PCs have either allied with her mercenaries or killed them, she casts summon monster II and summons a lemure, directing it to stand in the square just north of the door and attack the first PC who enters the room.
Monster.DuringCombat: Celeena casts ray of enfeeblement first, hitting the PCs fighting the lemure and trying to weaken them. She then uses her wand of magic missile for ranged attacks and casts color spray and burning hands once the PCs get closer. If the lemure falls and she has time, she summons another to prevent the PCs from reaching her.
Monster.Morale: Celeena is obsessed but not stupid–if reduce to 5 hit points or fewer, she surrenders.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds, scroll of mage armor (already used), wand of magic missile (50 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork shortspear
Monster.BaseStatistics: AC 11, touch 11, flat-footed 10 (+1 Dex)

Monster.Name: Makarius Bourtze, Tribune Of Evondemor
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 9, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 8, Cha 14
Monster.Feats: Leadership, Persuasive, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Shield Focus
Monster.Skills: Bluff +10, Diplomacy +14, Intimidate +14, Knowledge (history) +4, Knowledge (nobility) +10, Linguistics +4, Ride +4, Sense Motive +4, Survival +3
Monster.DuringCombat: Makarius stays behind the PCs, engaging foes only if pressed.
Monster.Morale: Having just seen his men massacred by the hags, Makarius has little stomach for more. If two or more of the PCs drop, Makarius bolts in panic.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure light wounds
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork breastplate, buckler, +1 longsword, dagger, composite longbow with 20 arrows, bronze holy symbol of Abadar, nobles' clothing

Monster.Name: Annis Hag
Monster.SpellLikeAbilities: Spell-Like Abilities (CL 7th; concentration +7) 3/day-alter self, fog cloud
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 25, Dex 12, Con 18, Int 13, Wis 13, Cha 10
Monster.Feats: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Great Fortitude, Intimidating Prowess
Monster.Skills: Bluff +7, Diplomacy +7, Intimidate +17, Perception +13, Stealth +7
Monster.BeforeCombat: One of the hags cast alter self to assume the guise of an injured guard. She bangs away on the door and cries to be let in. If she makes it inside, she approaches a healer for help. The other hag waits until the first has been let in, and then crashes through a nearby outside wall (DC 18 Strength check) and attacks.
Monster.DuringCombat: If the hags see obvious spellcasters or archers among the PCs, one of them drops fog cloud on the first round of combat. The hags stick together and try to flank one PC at a time if possible.
Monster.Morale: Summoned and enchanted by the alabaster urn, the hags fight to the death.

Monster.Name: Wager
Monster.Speed_Mod: Step Up
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 10, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Intimidating Prowess, Mobility, Step Up, Toughness, Weapon Focus (guisarme), Weapon Specialization (guisarme)
Monster.Skills: Intimidate +12, Knowledge (local) +2, Perception +6, Ride +3, Survival +9
Monster.SQ: armor training 1, weapon training (polearms)
Monster.DuringCombat: Wager charges any PC who has mouthed off to him. He keeps opponents at reach whenever possible and uses Step Up to follow if they try to 5-foot-step away from him. He attempts to trip heavily armored opponents before he attacks them.
Monster.Morale: Wager surrenders only if he's reduced to 20 hit points or fewer and all of his troops are dead.
Monster.Gear: potion of cure serious wounds
Monster.OtherGear: half-plate, +1 guisarme, cloak of resistance +1

Monster.Name: Wager's Archer
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 14, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 12, Wis 10, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, Toughness, Weapon Focus (composite longbow)
Monster.Skills: Intimidate +4, Knowledge (local) +2, Knowledge (nature) +2, Perception +2, Ride +5, Survival +4
Monster.BeforeCombat: The archers hide in the nearby ruins (Perception DC 23).
Monster.DuringCombat: The archers stay at range whenever possible and rain arrows down on the PCs who seem to be causing the most harm to Wager.
Monster.Morale: The archers fight to the death if Wager is alive. If Wager dies, they fight until reduced to 5 hit points or fewer, at which point they flee.
Monster.Gear: chain shirt, masterwork composite longbow with 20 arrows, longsword

Monster.Name: Sabas The Simple
Monster.Saves: Fort +3, Ref +7, Will +4; +4 vs. bardic performance, language- dependent, and sonic
Monster.Save_Mods: +4 vs. bardic performance, language- dependent, and sonic
Monster.SpecialAttacks: bardic performance (25 rounds/day, move action), countersong, distraction, fascinate (DC 16), inspire competence +3, inspire courage +2, suggestion (DC 16)
Monster.SpellsKnown: Spells Known (CL 7th; concentration +10) 3rd (2/day)-charm monster (DC 17), confusion (DC 17) 2nd (4/day)-glitterdust (DC 14), invisibility, misdirection (DC 14), suggestion (DC 16) 1st (5/day)-comprehend languages, cure light wounds, hideous laughter (DC 15), obscure object, ventriloquism 0 (at will)-dancing lights, detect magic, ghost sound, message, prestidigitation
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 8, Cha 17
Monster.Feats: Extra Performance, Greater Spell Focus (enchantment), Leadership, Skill Focus (Perform [Comedy]), Spell Focus (enchantment)
Monster.Skills: Acrobatics +16, Bluff +16, Diplomacy +12, Intimidate +16, Knowledge (arcana) +12, Knowledge (dungeoneering) +9, Knowledge (geography) +9, Knowledge (history) +9, Knowledge (local) +12, Knowledge (nobility) +11, Knowledge (planes) +9, Perform (comedy) +16, Perform (dance) +16, Perform (keyboard instruments) +13, Sleight of Hand +9, Stealth +11, Use Magic Device +13
Monster.SQ: bardic knowledge +3, jack-of-all-trades (use any skill), lore master 1/day, versatile performance (comedy: Bluff, Intimidate; keyboard instruments: Diplomacy, Intimidate), well-versed
Monster.BeforeCombat: If he hears the PCs approaching the citadel, Sabas moves down from his lair on the top floor, casting ventriloquism and then invisibility.
Monster.DuringCombat: Once the PCs are in the citadel, Sabas uses rude comedy to inspire courage in his allies and moves to hide from the PCs. He then casts confusion, followed with web (with his wand) to separate casters from their confused allies and trap them in melee.
Monster.Morale: Sabas flees if he's reduced to 15 hit points.
Monster.Gear: wand of touch of idiocy (20 charges), wand of web (17 charges)
Monster.OtherGear: masterwork chain shirt, masterwork buckler, masterwork rapier, shortbow with 20 arrows, mismatched courtier's clothing, hurdy gurdy, spell component pouch

Monster.Name: Baran
Monster.AbilitiyScores: Str 18, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 12, Wis 10, Cha 8
Monster.Feats: Dodge, Improved Initiative, Intimidating Prowess, Mobility, Step Up, Toughness, Weapon Focus (guisarme), Weapon Specialization (guisarme)
Monster.Skills: Intimidate +12, Knowledge (local) +2, Perception +6, Ride +3, Survival +9
Monster.SQ: armor training 1, weapon training (polearms)
Monster.DuringCombat: Baran is under the effects of Sabas's charm monster spell and attacks whomever Sabas tells him too. It's a DC 16 Spellcraft check to notice Sabas is charmed–if the PCs manage to break the charm, Baran immediately turns on Sabas.
Monster.Morale: While charmed, Baran fights to the death. If the charm is broken, Baran attacks Sabas and then surrenders to the PCs.
